newsitem.title: GERMANY: ProSieben chief unimpressed with grey market.
newsitem.headline: ProSieben chief unimpressed with grey market.

text.p: The chairman of television group ProSieben Media AG said on Monday he paid little attention to the surge in the company's share price in pre-listing grey market trade.
Georg Kofler, speaking to analysts ahead of bookbuilding which begins on Tuesday, said the company's share price range of 66-72 was "realistic with both feet on the ground".
"What is happening on the grey market does not impress me at all," he said. "There is not a lot of volume being traded."
Grey market trade in ProSieben shares surged after the company announced a lower-than-expected price range for bookbuilding. Shares were trading at well over 100 marks ($57.87).
Kofler said the company's popularity, its effective advertising campaign and the fact that it is the first German TV group to go public combined to boost interest in the offering.
He added, however, that the price range was set with a long-term strategy in mind that would allow for share price gains.
"We consider this to be the beginning of the long-term entry onto capital markets. We want to build up our long-term credibility," he said.
